content:
My opinion, that functions:

  • resolve()
  • elementDefinition()
  • conformsTo()

expand fhirpath scope too much and bring ref impl client into engine :(.

resolve can be implemented after getting result of fhirpath and walking in your runtime thro resulting collection
elementsDefinition means fhirpath knows and contains FHIR metadata
conformsTo means fhirpath includes profile validator

We already discussed to split fhirpath into two parts - so this 3 possibly belong to second one.
As well time algebra :)
@Bryn Rhodes @Grahame Grieve @Josh Mandel @Ewout Kramer what do you think?

Hi @nicola (RIO/SS) , these aspects are all already part of the FHIR-specific extensions for FHIRPath, not the core FHiRPath spec. I donâ€™t know the extent to which these features are used in invariants in FHIR, though, that would definitely be a good thing to clarify.
we use resolve() heaps.Not so much the others
